comments.body: Ping [~ajisakaa]. I've no idea why the Jenkins did not complain about this but I can not compile on my local machine.
Ping [~uncleGen]. Can you kindly help test this? We recently refactored the base contract test class. Thanks,
I can compile successfully, but my IDE cannot. Anyway, I'm +1 for your patch to add missing imports. It's better to write the import statements in the java file instead of relying on the superclass.

Committed this to trunk. Thanks [~liuml07] for the contribution.
(Sorry I forgot to check the result of precommit jenkins job when committing.)

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #11797 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/11797/])
HADOOP-14458. Add missing imports to (aajisaka: rev 07e60f85d87ca9a585d351a308ee0ecfa9293750)
* (edit) hadoop-tools/hadoop-aliyun/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/aliyun/oss/TestAliyunOSSFileSystemContract.java

Thanks [~ajisakaa] for review and commit. I was also wondering why this was not reported by Jenkins or anyone else. [~xyao] told me offline that the aliyun test jar was not built. Maybe there is a misconfiguration\(?) in the pom.xml there. I'll create separate JIRA if I have anything new.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #14057 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/14057/])
HADOOP-14458. Add missing imports to (xyao: rev d86fbcf0840dc1e29b2d678149bdfb5cc61ba85d)
* (edit) hadoop-tools/hadoop-aliyun/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/aliyun/oss/TestAliyunOSSFileSystemContract.java
